alert.note: Alert for Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 2:28PM EST until March 03 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Wayne County in south central Kentucky... Southwestern Laurel County in south central Kentucky... Southeastern Pulaski County in south central Kentucky... Central McCreary County in south central Kentucky... * Until 300 PM EST. * At 228 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mount Pisgah, or 12 miles south of Monticello, moving northeast at 85 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Kidds Crossing around 235 PM EST. Delta around 240 PM EST. Alpine around 245 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Dykes. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for south central Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for south central Kentucky.
